page.title: 11LANDSCAPE - W. LEOMINSTER
page.content: The ground is gently undulating with the highest point approximately 350 ft. above sea level. There are many small streams feeding the River Lugg to the north and River Arrow to the south. The Welsh border hills are visible in the distance. In the north of the area there are some typical Herefordshire lath and plaster cottages, but in the south the new housing estates are red-brick 'boxes'. The only public house, near to both housing estates, is an interesting, part fifteenth century, black and white timbered building, with modern addition. In the hamlet of Cobnash there is a disused water mill, which would have been powered by Pinsley Brook.
